addition, neither CH 3 OH or C 2 H 5 OH, nor other carbon compounds was found by introducing N 2 instead of CO 2 into the photocatalyst suspension under visible light irradiation.This indicates that the photocatalysts and their residual intermediates do not contribute the organic products, and CO 2 is the only carbon source in the photoreduction reaction.The yields of methanol and ethanol depended on the irradiation time over the as-synthesized photocatalysts are shown in Fig. 8.It can be seen that pure

HCO 3 -and H 2 CO 3 generated in CO 2 aqueous solution would be the reactive substrates during the photoreduction reaction, proving the thermodynamic feasibility of CO 2 photoreduction.This work demonstrated that MoS 2 is a very promising candidate for development of highly active photocatalysts, and supplied a facile and simple strategy for designing environmentally benign, cheap non-noble metal, and highly efficient semiconductor composites.
